items.title: Pre-Independence Indian Coins — Mughal Coinage (Part I)
Mughal Coinage: AH/AD span & Part I rulers list
notes: Index of emperors covered in Part I with AH/AD ranges.

items.title: Mughal Emperors — table (Babur to Kam Bakhsh)
notes: Bilingual table of emperors with AH/AD and years ruled.

items.title: Mughal Emperors — table (Shah Alam I to Bahadur Shah II)
notes: Includes total years of rule and deposition year; Persian month names legend.

items.title: Intro: Mughal coins — date, regnal year, mint, calligraphy
notes: Introductory board emphasizing historical data carried on coins.

items.title: Babur (Zahir-ud-din Muhammad) — coin examples
notes: Two mounted pieces labelled ‘Babar/Babur’ with AH 932–937; early Mughal issues.

items.title: Humayun (Nasir-ud-din Muhammad) — types & legends
notes: Board text describes Shahada & Rashidun names on obv; mihrab-cartouche rev; tray shows multiple dates/mints.

items.title: Akbar (Jalal-ud-din Muhammad) — early copper
notes: Flips annotated with regnal/AH years; one labelled ‘Gobindpur Mint — Double Dam’.

items.title: Akbar — silver denominations and mint variety
notes: Lower rows show clear silver legends; several flips note Ahmedabad/Agra with AH/AD pairs.

items.title: Akbar — additional mints
items.region: Hissar Firoza, Jodhp… (Jodhpur), Katak (Regnal), Lahore, Ahmedabad, Ujjain etc.
notes: Flip notes include Katak regnal, Lahore 1004 AH (1596 AD), and other city mints.

items.title: Jahangir (Nur-ud-din Muhammad) — monthly/Ilahi issues (Patna mint series)
notes: Twelve flips labelled ‘1st month…12th month — Ilahi’; most annotated ‘Patna Mint’ with specific AH/AD.

items.title: Jahangir — other mints (Ahmadnagar, Qanauj, Tatta)
notes: Flips show Ahmadnagar ‘Kalima variety’, Qanauj AH 1021 / 1612 AD, Tatta AH 1022 / 1613 AD.

items.title: Shah Jahan I — early issues & mint variety
items.region: Patna, Akbarabad (Agra), Surat, Multan, Qandhar etc.
notes: Multiple flips cite Patna; others note Akbarabad 1037 AH (1628 AD), Surat, Multan and Qandhar mints.

items.title: Shah Jahan I — later issues (incl. Lahore, Daulatabad, Patna)
notes: Top row coins annotated Lahore and Daulatabad; bottom row shows small square-flan pieces with AH 1039 (1629 AD).

items.title: Aurangzeb Alamgir — northern & eastern mints
notes: Flips show Akbarabad AH 1081, Etawa AH 1116, Khambayat (H), Lucknow and Patna mints with late-17th-century dates.

items.title: Aurangzeb Alamgir — Deccan & west coast mints
items.region: Banaras, Bijapur, Golkonda, Janagarh, Lahore, Multan, Mazaffarabad, Surat, Shahjahanabad
notes: Series includes coastal Surat issues (AH 1111/1703 AD) and Deccan mints like Golkonda.

items.title: Shah Alam I (Qutb-ud-din) — mint spread
notes: Sequential ‘1 Julus, 2 Julus…’ flips for Azimabad; other flips note Khujista-bad and Surat.

items.title: Jahandar Shah — brief reign issues
notes: Two mounted pieces: Surat Mint and Shahjahanabad with AH 1124 (1712 AD).

items.title: Farrukhsiyar — multiple mints
items.region: Azimabad (Patna), Akbarabad (Agra), Arcot, Etawa, Murshidabad, Shahjahanabad, Shahbaz-nagar etc.
notes: Board of nine flips including Arcot and Murshidabad; several marked ‘Julus’ with AH/AD pairs.

items.title: Farrukhsiyar — continuation
notes: Second tray continues same ruler and mint variety.

items.title: Rafi-ud-Darjat & Shah Jahan II — brief issues
notes: Left: Rafi-ud-Darjat (Shams-ud-din Muhammad), Shahjahanabad mint; Right: Shah Jahan II (Rafi-ud-Daula), Surat mint.

items.title: Context note — Nisar/Nazrana/Jiginasri coins
notes: Hindi note on fractional ‘Nisar’ pieces, large presentation ‘Nazrana’ coins, and very heavy gold pieces in Jahangir’s reign.

items.title: Pre-Independence Indian Coins — Mughal Coinage (Part II)
Muhammad Shah (Rangeela) — early reign
notes: Initial year issues of Muhammad Shah, with coins marked 1 Julus, 2 Julus, etc.
Mint cities like Delhi and Murshidabad visible on flips.

items.title: Muhammad Shah — mid-reign issues
notes: Flips feature coins from Surat, Patna (Azimabad), Shahjahanabad and others.

items.title: Muhammad Shah — later reign, broader mint network
notes: Coins marked from far-reaching provinces including Murshidabad (Bengal) and Arcot (South India).

items.title: Ahmad Shah Bahadur — short reign issues
notes: Flips marked with regnal years 1–6 Julus.
Known for the decline of Mughal central authority.

items.title: Alamgir II — coins from key mints
notes: Various flips marked ‘1 Julus’, ‘2 Julus’ etc. for Alamgir II.

items.title: Shah Alam II — early reign issues
items.region: Delhi, Shahjahanabad, Bengal, Gujarat, South India
notes: Flips include coins marked AH 1173 and onwards; key mints like Shahjahanabad, Surat, Murshidabad.

items.title: Shah Alam II — mid-reign, provincial issues
notes: Provinces asserting independence — coins feature local names alongside emperor's name.

items.title: Shah Alam II — late reign issues
notes: Coins issued during the era of Maratha dominance and British influence.

items.title: Akbar II — early coins
notes: Early coins with clear Persian legends and regnal year marks.

items.title: Akbar II — continued issues
notes: Mint marks indicate shifting power to regional Nawabs.

items.title: Bahadur Shah II (Zafar) — final Mughal emperor
notes: Coins from the twilight of Mughal authority, shortly before the Revolt of 1857.

items.title: Special commemorative & presentation coins
notes: Nazrana coins and other large ceremonial pieces with elaborate calligraphy.

items.title: Mint names and Persian terms reference
notes: Glossary of Persian mint names, regnal terms, and coin designations.
